newsitem.title: ITALY: Omnitel could be worth 10-15 trln lire.
newsitem.headline: Omnitel could be worth 10-15 trln lire.

text.p: Italy's second mobile phone supplier Omnitel could be valued at 10-15 trillion lire, Roberto Colaninno the chief executive of Olivetti, which is Omnitel's largest shareholder, said on Thursday.
Colaninno was addressing an Olivetti analysts' meeting where he confirmed that Omnitel was aiming to break-even in 1998.
He added that Omnitel was forecasting 1.5 million users for its digital GSM service by the end of this year after the group topped one million users in late April.

Italy's overall mobile phone market could reached 20 million users by the year 2000 from over seven million currently, said Colaninno. Omnitel's only rival, the state-controlled Telecom Italia Mobile (TIM), said it had 6.4 million users of its GSM and older analogue mobile phone services in late April.
